intro: Eccoilopus longesetosus, commonly known as the long-hair fern, is a species of fern characterized by its intricate fronds and delicate, feathery appearance. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features long, slender fronds with fine, soft hairs that give it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Its botanical structure includes a rhizome that supports the growth of its aerial fronds.
